oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Plan of the City of Knoxville, 1855
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: A.M. Lea
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Plan of the City of Knoxville, 1855. New York: Ferd. Mayer & Co., Lith. [1855?]. 32 x 26 inches. “Surveyed and compiled under the direction of A. M. Lea.” (Albert Miller Lea (1808-1891)). The Holston River depicted on the map was later renamed the Tennessee River. Three railroad depots are shown on the map: East Tennessee-Georgia and East Tennessee-Virginia Railroad; East Tennessee & Kentucky Railroad; and the Knoxville & Charleston Railroad. 1 inch=300 feet .
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Plans; Maps;
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814.
